definitions.definition: remove (a substance) from the surface of a liquid.
examples: as the scum rises, skim it off

definitions.definition: remove a substance from the surface of (a liquid).
examples: bring to the boil, then skim it to remove any foam

definitions.definition: steal or embezzle (money), especially in small amounts over a period of time.
examples: she was skimming money from the household kitty

definitions.definition: fraudulently copy (credit or debit card details) with a card swipe or other device.
go or move quickly and lightly over or on a surface or through the air.
examples: he let his fingers skim across her shoulders
synonyms: float "the boat skimmed over the water"

definitions.definition: pass over (a surface), nearly or lightly touching it in the process.
examples: we stood on the bridge, watching swallows skimming the water

definitions.definition: throw (a flat stone) low over an expanse of water so that it bounces on the surface several times.
examples: throw, toss, cast, pitch; bounce he skimmed the pebble across the water

definitions.definition: read (something) quickly or cursorily so as to note only the important points.
examples: he sat down and skimmed the report
synonyms: run one's eye over "she skimmed through the newspaper"

definitions.definition: deal with or treat (a subject) briefly or superficially.
examples: mention briefly, pass over quickly, skate over, gloss over Hannah skimmed over this part of the story

definitions.definition: a thin layer of a substance on the surface of a liquid.
an act of reading something quickly or superficially.
examples: a quick skim through the pamphlet
